caller_intent: The caller is seeking life insurance options, specifically comparing term and permanent policies, and is looking for lower costs than a previous quote. They want to understand coverage amounts, pricing, and available terms.
resolution_steps: Agent confirmed caller's age (64), health status (type 2 diabetic, no tobacco use), and existing insurance status.
Agent explained term insurance maximum duration (10 years for someone over 50) and minimum coverage ($100,000).
Agent ran a quote for $100,000 term over 20 years, resulting in ~$68/month.
Agent clarified that $100,000 is the minimum term coverage available and that lower amounts (e.g., $50k) are not offered.
Agent mentioned whole life (permanent) insurance as an alternative, noting it would be more expensive.
knowledge_required: Life insurance product structures (term vs. whole life)
Underwriting rules for coverage amounts and terms based on age/health
systems_referenced: Insurance quoting system (used to generate term policy quote)
summary: A 64-year-old diabetic caller sought life insurance options with lower costs than a previous quote. The agent explained that $100,000 is the minimum term coverage available through their carrier, resulting in ~$68/month for a 20-year term. The caller found this too expensive and inquired about lower amounts, but the agent confirmed $100k is the minimum. Whole life insurance was presented as an alternative, though more expensive. The caller remains undecided and may need further consideration.
